question: If <katex>$\Delta=\begin{vmatrix}1&a&a^{2}\\ 1&b&b^{2}\\ 1&c&c^{2}\end{vmatrix}$</katex> and <katex>$\Delta_{1}=\begin{vmatrix}1&1&1\\ bc&ca&ab\\ a&b&c\end{vmatrix}$</katex> then
explanation: Consider <katex>$\Delta_1 = \begin{vmatrix}1&1&1\\ bc&ca&ab\\ a&b&c\end{vmatrix}$</katex>. Multiply R1 by a, R2 by b, R3 by c is not feasible directly. Instead multiply C1 by a, C2 by b, C3 by c and divide by abc?
Let's interchange rows/columns. Swap R2 and R3: <katex>$\Delta_1 = -\begin{vmatrix}1&1&1\\ a&b&c\\ bc&ca&ab\end{vmatrix}$</katex>.
Multiply C1 by a, C2 by b, C3 by c and divide by abc: <katex>$\Delta_1 = -\frac{1}{abc} \begin{vmatrix}a&b&c\\ a^2&b^2&c^2\\ abc&abc&abc\end{vmatrix}$</katex>.
Take abc common from R3: <katex>$\Delta_1 = -\frac{abc}{abc} \begin{vmatrix}a&b&c\\ a^2&b^2&c^2\\ 1&1&1\end{vmatrix} = -\begin{vmatrix}a&b&c\\ a^2&b^2&c^2\\ 1&1&1\end{vmatrix}$</katex>.
Interchange R1 and R3: <katex>$\Delta_1 = -(-\begin{vmatrix}1&1&1\\ a^2&b^2&c^2\\ a&b&c\end{vmatrix}) = \begin{vmatrix}1&1&1\\ a^2&b^2&c^2\\ a&b&c\end{vmatrix}$</katex>.
Interchange R2 and R3: <katex>$\Delta_1 = -\begin{vmatrix}1&1&1\\ a&b&c\\ a^2&b^2&c^2\end{vmatrix} = -\Delta$</katex> (Taking transpose of standard Vandermonde determinant).
